QCwbWshulVz7-_ICymsWZA.text: This is a young person's bar/club. It's a meat market and quite tacky. I wouldn't recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Tiger Tiger - London, United Kingdom

90if2JfSkni9uYGldhlvGg.text: Hm, being a High School Senior from the U.S.,Me and my friends enjoyed our visit . Goodtimes.

I59EhMi_IjSQS3qAAqXZVw.text: Once, I temporarily lost my mind and went to Tiger Tiger. It's a long time ago now, but I'm still traumatised. Though I have to admit that at first I was fascinated. The place is gigantic, spanning several floors (at least two, and as I recall there was a dingy basement section somewhere as well) and with a bewildering number of different rooms. And every single centimeter is taken up with writhing sweaty human flesh, constantly moving in search for easy prey, it's like a human conveyor belt. Standing on top of the big staircase overlooking the ground floor you get a good overview of the bustling activity down below, it's like watching ants on an anthill. This place is a mecca for anyone interested in observing the more primitive variants of human mating rituals. With a voice-over by David Attenborough it would have been perfect. Fascinating at first, yes, but a few hours of this is enough to turn any sane person into an ardent misanthrope. Oh, and watch out for the pelvis grinders  men who grind their pelvis against you by way of introducing themselves. Call me old-fashioned, but what's wrong with just saying hello?

cYSw7nkD_JE6NgvWODZZ8Q.text: Great location, but very expensive to get in of an evening (there are better cheaper venues around here offering something more unique). Quite crowded once in, and again reasonably pricey. Overall, not the greatest nightclub in the world.

JIL_tj8SRXdNeYv172YkyA.text: Tiger Tiger is a good place to go for a dance and some late night drinks. It can be difficult to get into as it get's so busy, and after about 7.30 they tend to have bouncers on the doors to keep the riff-raff out - you won't get in if you're in jeans and trainers, no matter how much you beg! The music and the atmosphere tends to be quite good, but the drinks are very expensive. They have a good selection of cocktails though. They also do food until about 10.

38EgoOQ5xg2bvGNaVf2vkg.text: They are letting all sorts of people over there, if you got an ID. I didn't liked it at all, just pathetic place to go.

jAFQPIelZwi9zDPOfVSlGg.text: Tiger Tiger is a massive place with 3 floors, they play mostly commercial tunes. The decoration is funky and the staff are really friendly. The only drawback is the crowd formed mostly by tourists, some can be really persistent and rude.But it is a great place to have a hen or birthday party.

qlGomJrKDqR2W-UbhwXy9w.text: Tiger is very nicely decorated but more authentic not clubby futre style. it has food fun dancefloors and bars and a separte restaurant seating. it even has a church on sun 11am called autjentic expression and is for the twirties age f=group 20-30s. This is real fun as it is modern style and they have drinks on the bar.very unusual place but great stuff

ds8bRZZFezZLae0dC6ZuxQ.text: This is one of the most popular branches of Tiger Tiger probably due to its location. Every night of the week you can see that it's packed out. You find that the music is different on certain nights so you may need to do some research to find which night suits your genre. You can get lost quite easily in this place and the cues for the locker room are a nightmare. You waste half your night standing in a line down the stairs. Overall this venue is okay if you're already quite drunk, not a good starter as a couple of drinks could probably buy you a meal out.

yk16ufEnkLDSWk-8wL-NAA.text: I got denied entry because I was wearing "trainers".  The bouncer told me to come back when I was serious.  I'm not sure why my English cousin wanted to go there. Later, I find out Al Qaeda wanted to blow the place up. Perhaps I was not the only one they were rude to for wearing "trainers".

qDoSNKNSEsS5KlG4Bzz67Q.text: This was the least favorite place I have ever been anywhere in probably the whole world as far as nightlife is concerned. I asked for a long island iced tea and got a splash of vodka in a coca cola. When I asked what exactly it was, I was told it was a long island. When I protested, the bartendress said I could leave and go elsewhere if I didn't like her drink-making abilities. So, we took her advice and left pretty quickly. Avoid avoid and then avoid again.

xtfRwdYzRkz8KCKE18vEhw.text: Overpriced horrible "bar."  I should have known when I walked in what it would be like.  Trendy bar that is always packed, god knows why.

fcBk3eowW4YgrvmaH3EpMA.text: its a fairly big club, playing all the chart tunes with different floors there is a slight variety in the music selection, but all mainstream hits. the drink are a standard price for central London price.it can give u a good night out if ur looking for the club/bar experience and can overlook the badly dressed barely legal's! at the weekends the queue is pretty sizable, guest list is probably a good option.

XovLx9wGzEiQLMMAiGX6Tw.text: I went to Tiger Tiger on a Monday student night and was apparently on the guest list, although the guest list queue seemed longer than the main one. Once in, I spent about half an hour amid a huge mass of people in what they called the line for the cloakroom. The club was quite big, with quite a few rooms, although they all seemed to be playing the same kind of commercial music, although maybe this was because it was student night. The crowd was mostly students, given that it was a student night, and they all ranged from drunk to very drunk.The only good thing about this place is that the drinks were very cheap - £2.50 for a double vodka redbull, with actual redbull, not any cheap knockoffs. Also, as there were quite a few bars in the place, the queue to get a drink wasn't that long. It was an interesting night out at Tiger Tiger but I don't think that I would be going back there anytime soon.

cMZ5y6v5xdJ5wNWEwWsqkg.text: Tiger Tiger is one of those places that I never plan to go to but always seem to end up here. Tiger Tiger used to be somewhere that we'd always walk past on our way to a club, but one day something changed, we ventured in and surprisingly had a really great time. Last year Tiger Tiger saw most of me and the girls' drunken moments. It's particularly ideal for me and my very loyal drinking partner in crime to go here, we both live either sides of London so it makes sense that we meet at this central drinking place. And every time we do we tell ourselves that we'll catch the last train home, but how easy is that to do when you know that Tiger Tiger doesn't close till three in the morning? Well, me and my friend could verify that it is in fact impossible. A night that was initially intended to be a quick drink ends up being a night of clubbing, meeting loads of cool people and getting incredibly drunk  I love this! In fact, Tiger Tiger's utmost appeal to me is it's bar like mentality, but ultimately is a club in disguise! The venue is absolutely huge with secret staircases, private rooms and restaurants dotted about the club, it also has two floors and two bars; To me this sounds like a night club, however if you arrive before nine you don't have to pay to get in, there is no queuing involved, you don't need to contact a promoter to get on a guest list and it is literally a hassle free way of going out and having an eventful night. Tiger Tiger's music is a bit kind of all over the place, one minute your dancing to Britney Spears, the next minute you know you're electric sliding to Earth Wind and Fire. But I don't mind this, as long as the DJ throws in a Funky House track I'm good to go. Tiger Tiger is by far the most friendliest place I've ever been to, I remember me and my friend were here one summer night when a girl initiated a conversation with me solely based on the fact that she loved the Spice Girls! I'm not sure how pleased I was about this, but the point is everybody here is so friendly and I've met such a huge range of people here. I can guarantee that most nights I end practicing my Spanish or Italian skills, playing guess the accent with South Africans or comparing British and American culture with Americans. Tiger Tiger is so mixed and I love it!Tiger Tiger, although having club like antics is as much a good place to dance as it is to have a chat, get some food and relax. Me and my friend always arrive in time for happy hour, where we get in enough bottles of wine to suffice us for a few hours along with some Nacho's and chicken burgers! Happy hour finishes at seven thirty and which explains why we always arrange to meet at seven fifteen.Sadly my partner in crime is fed up of Tiger Tiger and whilst trying to pick our new hang out I'm suffering from withdrawal symptoms, nevertheless you should go and get hooked!

NqeAVnHfFgUQ-JdgxppQzg.text: Lunch time food OK but surroundings very tatty. Inspect the seating first, I left with chewing gum stuck to my trousers.

E61ZnRy_qVn7o7D2zZbztA.text: Although this venue seems to have garnered a bit of a bad reputation for itself, when you actually visit the place yourself you will find that it is often totally different to what you expected. The location is very easy to get to from either Leicester square or Piccadilly station and it is always busy most nights of the week. The bar is stretched over 3 different main areas. And has a funky stylish interior. The last time we went there we had what we reckoned were some of the best mojitos this side of the river! The music selection is good and it's only downside is that its not open until later.

Xc-HfapHKaWSkrIutEUJew.text: Tiger Tiger is in the perfect location, it is close to nightbuses, lots of other clubs and famous placese like Leicester Sq and Picadilly Circus. But inside it is very crowded and badly decorated. The music is ok and the drinks are not too expensive, but all in all i dont think that i need to go there twice. Disappointing!

s27NJeC1S4l2qv23SOQK_A.text: TigerTiger sucked.  Walking in with several female friends, as a guy we had to pay more than them walking in.  There were no specials.  Also, buying drinks they rip you off.  The people walking around with the 'alcohol' holsters charges  £2 for a shot, well, its basically a shot flavored water.  At the bar, I asked for a double shot of Jack, and the bartender gave about half a shot and charged me for a double.  If you are from the US don't bother going, they'll rip you off any way they can.  Pubs are MUCH more fun than this shithole, and pubs are free!

ZTTT2JRcqOIYIK637ztXNQ.text: Not King of the JungleThe happy hour may be cheap, the bar may be in close proximity to your work. But I warn you, do not, I repeat not go here. It is filled with wanky suits and dizzy secretaries trying to pull eachother. There are plenty of better places up the road in Soho. I would rather go to a Pitcher and Piano than go to Tiger Tiger (and that is saying a lot.)

BcfQ1pzMsV-MzqmPzNwROQ.text: There was a time when I was 18, thought I was the coolest kid ever with my fake ID, and was told by a hotel concierge that Tiger Tiger would be an awesome party spot in Piccadilly Circus to dance with a younger crowd. The concierge had been pretty spot-on about places to go and things to do, so I trusted his judgment. Naturally, I HAD to go! My friends and I arrived early enough to avoid the cover charge and meandered around the first floor. It was all old, used up, 50-something year old guys. Which is great if that's your thing. Maybe it was Old Timer's Night, who knows. These guys were speaking about university life in the 1960s and JFK's assassination, which would make them older than my dad. Maybe it was a fluke, my group thought, so we headed upstairs. Same story, different floor apparently. No one was dancing either, just sort of standing around or bobbing their heads to remixes of Top 40 songs. It was really quite a disappointing scene based on all of the hype, but over the years, I've come to learn that most of Piccadilly is that way (and overpriced).

dsxUN3_AkVc4MbV01F7eNg.text: This place is too overpriced. They should make reserving tables more affordable for people to celebrate their birthdays. Although the location is good and also the interior.

NJGz9MwtPH4ZROGIJWNcYw.text: Went here last Thursday for a works leaving do and we had a great time! We started at lunchtime and having booked a table and pre-ordered our food to make life easier we were promptly brought our drinks. The food was really good and the service was friendly. We ended up staying all afternoon and all evening taking full advantage of the happy hour between 5  8pm when all drinks are half price!

V5iYg8Jnte0AecYuU-9ogg.text: What a load of rubbish. Booked my Bday there only to arrive with my work friends to find out they only put us on the guest list no tables booked. Not only that they have bar staff who dont listen i asked for a single drink twice the bar tender reaffirmed my order then brought me a double anyway. When I showed I was not pleased and want a refund on my Card he sent for security to kick me out. I still have not had a refund. My conclusion there a bunch of thiefs!!! I highly recommend you stay away from this establishment. the music crap the service is crap. and the bar staff are crap!!!!!!!!

rtDfYfvzgv0OhFSItX7S1A.text: Nnn-sis  Nnn-sisNnn-sis(Continue this bass-thumping beat throughout the review for long-lasting magical effect.)We knew exactly what we were getting into, which is why I can only smile about my big kitty experience. And hell, if you can't beat 'em, you might as well jump right in with a set of ear plugs and a healthy sense of humour. (Be sure your vaccinations are up to date as well.)The conditions were perfect. It was New Years Eve and we were 'lucky' enough to score some free tickets to this fine, fine establishment. And let me just say, it was terrible in all of the most wonderful ways. Sweet sweet baby Jesus music from washed out boy band E17, cougars and silver-foxes mixing joyously with rookies out celebrating amateur night, 19-year-olds outside trying to persuade the black-clad bouncers to turn the other way while they jovially bunny hopped inside. Conditions were perfect. Seriously. I would be lying if I said that my date and I didn't have a bang-up time. Drinks easily accessible at a multitude of bars, loud music on 6 dance floors, balloons and champagne at midnight, and overall drunken debauchery made Tiger Tiger completely tolerable. Luckily I was too rat assed to be upset about the hour long coat check line, the weak expensive drinks, or the fact that the entire experience was a pulsating, hormonal, sweatastic STD-waiting to happen. Rrrarrr! ... and yes, that's how I *really* feel.

oXE8SZzWtUQ6S-YmAicAMg.text: Meow. Meow. That's pretty much all this redundant cat has to offer me. We wanted to dance. And drink. So we donned our backless clubbing tops and heels and away we went. I think I'm too old for this.

MXFevSIwVhcIW4smbNMUaw.text: 5 pounds for an effing budweiser??? You've got to be kidding me.After a 12 pound cover, I kind of expected a good time. Instead I go alot of young men in suits that lived in Essex hitting on me. But didn't buy me an overpriced budweiser. So I came away from that encounter both broke AND sober. So sad.

Rfzx0C7hc0XsL_QT1DiSoQ.text: Not my ideal club it has its moments I like the white room the crowd is highly predictable and the music is typical house. The bonus is happy our if you reach there in time but apart from that not my number one pick.

9sQMnwzQsT4e-41NxrIF7g.text: It's a Sunday, you have to get on a plane the next day to fly across the ocean for 12 hours and you want to get together with a few friends since you won't be back for a few weeks. Friend 1 insists on going here, as "there are some really cool and hot German girls that are meeting us there." You figure, well, I like cool girls, hot girls, and haven't met many German girls, so why not. Fortunately, you get there before 9pm, so there is no cover or strict dress code. From here, you, your friends and the aforementioned German girls are issued a poor man's cowboy hat. So, you get your drink on, sticking to beer and tequila shots. Before you know it, you are knackered off your arse, haven't packed for the flight and are now in Soho pondering how to get back to your flat. I remember that about every 6th - 7th song was actually decent. The DJ wasn't total crap and you get drown out the thumbing bass to have a conversation where at any given moment, the person you are talking to yells some across the table in German then continues what she was saying. Needless to say, the flight the next day was rough. Flying at 36,000 feet does not help being hungover/still drunk. However, it was a good send off and I enjoyed Tiger Tiger. Will I likely go here again? Yes, simply cause I am easy going and know my friend will want to go back.

qo9dQhGVK2gARSx1GwnfGQ.text: Had some fantastic nights here. It is a bit of a meat market at times but if you want to boogie on down or evening have something to eat whilst drinking it's the place to go. I like the different areas and variety of people you find in here.

vZaaRonUVbfLZpSGodJVew.text: Expensive drinks, seizure-inducing lights and smoke, a million different rooms to get lost in, mean staff in the cloakroom and £2 to check coats!, ridiculous cover, top 40s and house music, girls in vinyl dresses selling shots and too many creepy middle-aged businessmen mingling in the crowds... We talked to a promoter who was supposed to get us in for less money but bailed on us last minute. Cool, Junior. Unsurprisingly, the only reason I had as much fun as I did was because I was already drunk and my friends are a blast. Save your £££ and go somewhere else.

MXFosIGJB1kDGW4bySX4Dg.text: It's alright, cooler looking that it actually is. Worse margarita I have every had though.This is for the younger crowd, I felt old. What happened to enjoying music and drinks... over priced, over hype.

Qn7JqOGYLxE7n7yh3aIMhw.text: This place reminds me of somewhere Christian Bales character from American Psycho would come for happy hour. One of the worst places I have been in London.

5j7qq4hHh6deZb1kT7_b2Q.text: This place is absolute rubbish!  If I wanted to go to a club to hear horrible music I could have found plenty of places to go here in Chicago.  Also it was packed with tourists, mostly Americans.  Unlike Julie B. I did not find it to be a gay bar, just a very obnoxious place, the sort of place I would hope to leave behind in the states.  On a side note, this place is tolerable for lunch where a meal can be had for as little as £4 (or at least that was what the advert said this past spring).  I believe  I had a soup and salad here for around £6 back in April.

photos.caption: Photo of Tiger Tiger - London, United Kingdom. 4 Lunch

X-YsV3NRSkHqccLM--e07g.text: After everyone had been recommending it for the past 3 weeks, I finally decided to check this place out. It is only a few blocks from my office, so it makes the prefect after work spot to hit up. The size of the place from the outside is a bit deceiving. Once you walk in and get your first drink, walk on up the stairs and check out the 3 different bars/clubs up there, each with it's own feel. The crowd was pretty good for a rainy evening and the drinks are really cheap during happy hour. The staff was very friendly and always ready to take your order at the bar downstairs. I'll definitely be back.

SkGmlT1g0s1SHk84tioPZA.text: Say what you will about the class of people in this place, the music is UNBEATABLE. i'm a Mayfair club loving girl, but when I just want to go dancing, this place has absolutely amazing music for a Californian. All the top charts with mixed in 80's. Tiger tiger is all about mentality! NOT a place to come meet a stand-up guy, NOT a place to sit down for deep conversations, just a place to dance the whole night! Before i knew it, it was 3am and we were getting kicked out.

bsyJGh2uJFYtBMQXnhsDWA.text: Honestly, it's been 8 years. But it is something I'll never forget. I was in London for a summer class. At 19, I didn't drink back home in the states, but went all out when it was legal in the UK. I had a BLAST. The guys weren't creepy, music is good, and drinks were, well, devoured. I will say this about drinking in the UK: it's better than the states because (I think) there are less preservatives or whatever, so you can literally drink until you drop and not get hungover. I'm going back to London in a few weeks, and I will definitely be hitting up Tiger Tiger!

MJGkpC1-STqojh2osw3i2A.text: Large venue compared to most London nightclubs, I found it had that Oceana feel to it. If thats what your looking for (i.e. chart tunes, large, busy, short skirts, sweaty, etc.) try it out. On the weekend there can be a bigish queue so get there early or questlist.

Tzwms1W_plMHXVPOKXB-5Q.text: Tiger Tiger gets my 5 stars. It is an absolutely amazingly cool club. It has about 5 bar areas and 2 dancefloors. What I loved the most was that one could order food during the entire night. Im not saying Ilike to have fried chicken or anythin on the dancefloor, but sometimes it is really nice to have a bit of munch.The crowd was very different. Equal amount of guys and girls and from ALL different nationalities. Tiger Tiger goes in my backup club category. It is a club that doesnt flop. It is rea;;y good everytime :). Pro's: Club with good standard, taste, trendy, very good price range and restaurant service all night. Con's: Very standard club

Z9LTYcbV-39DPGoTOT6fGA.text: Just down from Piccadilly Circus, Tiger Tiger is decent if you like a large bar/club with the option for different areas. There are three floors: downstairs tends to be very crowded, but upstairs is usually more relaxed if you're not in the mood for a crowded dance floor. None of it could be described as chilled out, though. There are rooms (or sections of rooms) you can book for private parties: I've been to a couple of these and it works well. You can order food well into the evening. The vibe is fairly friendly and inclusive. However, its location means it gets a lot of tourists, and its size means that it gets its fair share of jerks and loud-mouthed groups.

QVV4dLv05oEFsNjyGdXvfw.text: RAAAR RRAAARRR.  I think that's an appropriate way to begin this review.  My roommate chose to go to Tiger Tiger to have a dance-y celebration of her birthday.  Now, I must say, because here, writing reviews, I can say whatever I want to say, that I love baking cookies.  I also may say that I was not so excited by the idea of going to Tiger Tiger.  I'm not really a fan of the Soho/Piccadilly nightlife.  As much as I love seeing really drunk girls stumbling around in skirts that must come from the movie "Honey I shrunk your Wardrobe," fending of sleazy men and rose sellers and dealing with long lines and high prices, this are is just not really my cup of tea  I was, therefore, surprised to find Tiger Tiger to be an alright kind of place, kind of like spaghetti bolognese.  My first once-over of the digs left the following assessment: black walls, big booths, an upper floor that looks like it came out of some sexy 70's disco film.  Hm.   Ok.  The crowd was well dressed, maybe not dressed to the nines, but not dressed to the ninnies or 'trying to be a nine but come out as 4.5 a  because they must have forgot the other half of my clothes at home.'  The music was a nice club mix of popular, yet rhythmic dance songs from Shakira to 'Love Generation' to a remix of Marc Anthony.  We danced, had fun and were merry like mince pies.  The rest of the friendly crowd was doing the same.  This place is not an extra special kind of club like clubs that give you free Victorian prams, but it's a decent type of place.

photos.caption: Photo of Tiger Tiger - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tiger Tiger - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tiger Tiger - London, United Kingdom

O4tdvbySP4GmZWYleCrB4Q.text: My one clubbing experience during my time in London was spent at Tiger Tiger, and it helped that one of my classmates had connections. We got the student charge of £7, which is comparable to clubs here in LA and apparently not that bad. The club itself is very much the same as LA clubs I've been to - nothing special about it. The music played is typical music you hear on the radio. Drinks are actually cheaper here than at LA clubs I've been to (cocktails are £3-4 vs. about £7 in LA). I've read the other reviews and I definitely agree that they weren't that strong.There definitely is a chav crowd here - one of our guys almost got into a fight with one.Overall, my experience here was memorable, only if it was my one clubbing experience in London and I got to be among young Brits. I can't say anything more or less than what I've said.

vo64AC-XeYEmyAat87ey0A.text: Nah nah ni. I drank many jugs of juicy cocktails through a straw straight out of the vessels they came in. I involuntarily sang along to N Dubz. I stared at a strange man who was wearing a black tux like suit, shiny white shirt and was wearing shades. Inside. I got very drunk. And all of this happened while it was still light outside. God bless happy hours. I don't feel well today. I blame Tiger Tiger and all the free drinks I drank with my buddies from work. Come here to get drunk and run with the chavs, just like Barcelona where you go run with bulls. But so much grosser. Approach with caution my friends. Don't try to be cool and sober as this place is a nightmare to anyone with any of their mental faculties remaining, you gotta get wasted and stupid and dance like you really do believe you're Lady Gaga. By midnight we had all lost each other and our coats. We laughed. We cried. We danced many a merry dance and spilled each others drinks. Just your typical Monday night really!

_KI5UPIfAuBC5fIV0VpEzA.text: If I had to envision the kind of bar I would least like to go to, this would be it.I have an unfortunate bunch of friends (well ... in some ways), some of which seem to think at times that Tiger Tiger would constitute a good night out.First of all, it's completely overpriced. Cover charges vary, but are nonsense ... tbh they'd make far more money off me with an exit fee - ransoming my freedom to get out of this hellhole. Cost of drinks is borderline extortionate. The prices get ratcheted even further by shots-girls. Complete rip-off.The venue is awful: vast characterless spaces; poorly ventilated; crap decor; overcrowded.The people ... good god the people. The only people who you'll find here, besides the poor souls who'd rather be anywhere else, are clueless tourists, Essex girls dressed up to the nines who consider this a classy London night out, scumbag dodgy bankers with more money than taste who want to pick up aforementioned gold-digging slappers who will be impressed by their wide-boy attitudes (if not their invariably tiny penis), students and under-age drinkers who can't get in anywhere else.Please for the love of Christ avoid it. The sooner people abandon this Dantean vision of the Abyss, the sooner it'll do us all a favour and go out of business.Is there no way to give it less than one star?

V5_h7Ts6VueX0MTbgR8LOQ.text: Here's the thing about my experiences at Tiger Tiger when I lived in London: I can't speak of any cover because I never had to pay one. Same goes for the drinks.  As far as the music goes, it was a lot of Top 40, but what boozed up group of girls wouldn't get on the dance floor to that?  No one is saying that it's the best bar in London or that it doesn't have the potential for being a huge tourist trap. What I do know is that there were always plenty of attractive men in business suits (try finding That stateside) and my girls and I shut this place down on more than one occasion.  And for that, I love TigerTiger.

G-QBfRjQhvagBMSMBpi9PA.text: I dont know why everyone hates this place. My girlfriend and I went there and we had fun. Everyone says that its pricey, I guess that might be the case. I dont think we paid to get in and I dont think we paid for drinks. I guess thats why I didnt taste the bitterness that everyone else does about this place. Well maybe I did, but that was because of the gin.  We are from San Diego, but I have to say that this was fun and had a good group of people and music. If I ever go back to London, I will certainly stop by this place.

ZIGoFnWD_CRbxWumYXyzGw.text: Very expensive drinks was everything that I remember from those drunken nights. And since I was drunk, I must had a good time. Three areas that serve different kind of music throughout the bar.

n9wuiUVJ0hP4NeztOin2Lg.text: Now, I don't know if I'm getting old. Or perhaps I'm jaded beyond my years, being the mature age of 21 but I find the crowd they pull in here to be a tad predictable. The two most definitive groups are Preppy (students or otherwise) or the girls who will inevitably be walking home crying and carrying their shoes, after their not so better halves not texting back right away or vice versa causing a whole riot of hilarity for onlookers. How's that for stigma? Chain clubs like this, Oceana, Liquid etc all fall prey to same thing. Rather than a group of friends go for a sociable drink, they get a prepubescent horde of kids getting absolutely shit faced.After 10 mins of being there I wanted to punch almost everyone in there aside from the barmen and the bouncers amusingly. They all seemed so dizzyingly confused by the abundance of Joop, fake tan and Peroxide it makes them quite endearing. In my latest years I've grown an awareness of my own personal space and I just want to lash out at everyone who comes within range. Which evidently with me is about 2 metres.Like I said, I might be getting old.

-NNJO95avTOvXzADVU-N3A.text: I have mixed feelings about Tiger Tiger. At first glance, this place is hoppin', full of young people, and the cover charge (10 pounds) isn't that bad, considering some average price around the London club scene. However, after a half hour here, I started noticing that Tiger Tiger attracts a strange kind of crowd. Lots of random, past-middle aged men gawking at girls, looking like their wives were wondering where they were at.I don't drink so I'm not sure of the beverage prices but all my friends said their mojitos didn't break the bank. Upstairs is a more relaxed atmosphere than downstairs; I recommend going up there first and grabbing a drink then heading down to the dance floor to boogie. They have an odd selection of tunes. They would play a couple great songs, then a terrible one, then another great one. Still, an alright playlist.

JuAaVg8RPdI2v-F_qJDRYA.text: I tend to avoid the West End and its drunk crowds nowadays, but returned to Tiger Tiger for a function the other day. I had forgotten quite how massive this place is.Personally, I prefer more intimate places. But if you like it big and busy, this is definitely one of the better venues in central London.

sHja0kwBZ2GKA5ggaBPqPQ.text: Fairly big club, different themed rooms. Good central location.However, it was so poorly ventilated that most rooms were extremely stuffy and smelling of booze. Awful!The crowd was aiming to get as drunk as possible, probably because they couldn't enjoy themselves to the crap music :-/The service at the bar took ages! The staff were slow plus they would ignore the customers to 'take a break'.. So unprofessional! Didn't like the place at all!

fEBCsNsyM4wDFNv_LIW4LA.text: So three years ago, when my friends and I studied abroad in London, one of my friends had her birthday celebration here.  We started off with dinner at the restaurant and the food was less than impressive.  It was very bland and was not worth the price they charged.  The decor of the restaurant wasn't all too grand either in comparison to their bar.However, the club downstairs was a different story.  They had different themed rooms with music to match.  The music wasn't all too bad either, except the dj started to replay a lot of the songs towards the end of the night.  The decor was very modern with pretty chandeliers.  The only problem my friends and I had was that there was not enough ventilation in there so we were sweating after an hour or two and we weren't even moving around that much.  The drinks were expensive compared to other clubs, but I have to admit, the drinks were one of the better ones I had tasted in London.  Or maybe it was just the bartender who mixed my drinks. Anyway, I had a fun night, thanks to my friends.  I don't know if I will revisit this place though, when I go back to London.  If I do, it will only be for the sentimental sake of my college days.

LyENc6o0dmD3uzxWHv2WIQ.text: this is a good little club, but be warned it is just a chain so it's not going to blow your mind on music, venue or drinks.

3k8I-hUwbi4K5A7ys5KFgw.text: I'm always less judgmental when I'm not in my own country. Maybe thats why I had a kickass time last Thursday AND Friday night at TigerTiger.After setting out to Picadilly Square with a group of half drunk Aussies and Americans we picked up 2 rowdy Brits who insisted we must go to TigerTiger. I thought they were kidding when they said this was the name of the establishment. 10 points for effort on originality in naming a club. Well, its midnight in London, you have no idea where you're going and some promoter dude just magically  handed you a free entry card to TigerTiger. Naturlich, I'm going to check this joint out.From the name of the place I was expecting the decor to look like an Asian Ed Hardy had puked all over. Surprisingly, not so! 2 levels, a bar on each, and a pretty hyped up crowd!Only complaints would be the music and the angry bouncers. I'm quite confident that Shakira-Hips Don't Lie played at least 3 times as did Flo-Rida's Low.  Apparently, finding a trance/house scene in London is a failed dream because most clubs don't play it and definitely don't during the weekday. Lame.Did I have fun? Check. Did I dance my butt off regardless if it was to the same song from 2006, twice? Check. Would I go back? Check.

wZrRbgsHUAAfZOt-hlXDng.text: Not again! We disliked Tiger Tiger very much! The club was full with grabby men and they had absolutely no style! Cruising on every women who walks by combined with that smell of booze no thank you. The drinks were not so good and we had the feeling, that everybody drinks until he can't stand on his own feet. This is why we didn't like the club. Oh, the music was fine! Just the crowd was bad!

8JgfQX3DMg6BZt8tk25ocg.text: Pretty basic club but not nearly as bad as people make it out to be. First off, it is pricey. If you get discounted admission, your one of the lucky ones. Otherwise it's pretty steep. The drink prices also reflect this. So come expecting to pay.The dance floor is not very well defined. When you come in people are dancing, awkwardly while waiting for drinks. Upstairs is the same story. The music is average. Nothing special. What made this a good night was the wait staff. About half of the "shots girls" were total $%^*es the other half were the coolest people I've ever met. They were giving us free shots and discounts. The bouncers were actually pretty cool also, which for me is hard to say. If your looking for a decent night with cool people check it out.

RAPDR2piDRuzK_MdRBBWOQ.text: I have not been here for 3 years, but I have been told by friends that the place has not changed much. I partied at Tiger Tiger one time for a friend's birthday celebration, in which we ate dinner first, then drank and danced on the extremely hot dance floor. The decor and ambiance seemed typical of a club that's trying too hard to be fancy: dim lighting, red accents, tiger sculpture in the bathroom, colorful bar area, in other words, nothing too original. Our dinner was more or less a reflection of this, and was not the best concoction flavors; but then again, I was a So-Cal girl in London with a palate use to fatty Mexican food and super size value meals, so I may not be the best critic of British cuisine. The club itself, however, was fun and the drinks were well made, but too expensive for the small amount of alcohol mixed in. The music was surprisingly danceable (sic), and everyone was dancing, unlike American clubs where the guys stand against the wall and the girls dance in circle formations. Overall, the atmosphere was really positive and full of energy. I do have to say though, the heater was on and the dance area became extremely hot and uncomfortable. It is fair to say I wouldn't mind giving this place another go the next time I'm in London.

nNoxeDZ2GL8dVUITdC0fpQ.text: Everyones review of this place is based on the nightlife aspect. I cant contribute to that because I came during the daytime for lunch.£5 lunch deals? Hell yes! Enjoyed a great lunch here with my friend. It was satisfying to find good food at such a low price considering we were nearing the end of our holiday in London.Great place for lunch.

z-GO_bfHN0pHrQ64w-2Avw.text: This place was a little strange. I'm not a club kind of person, but headed out to meet up with one of my old friends while vacationing in London. We got in free since one of his friends had passes, and didn't have any problems while at the door.At a place like this, naturally my first instinct is to head straight to the bar so I can forget the fact that I'm in a place like this. It's fulfilled with tacky decor, and "chavs" as I'm told they're called here. Let's just say it's not the classiest of places despite its desperate attempts to portray that image. I'm confident that the cast of Jersey Shore would LOVE it here.The bartenders are rude and the drinks are way overpriced especially considering the fact that you could barely taste the alcohol in them. I tried multiple times to get a draft beer, but was told there were no clean glasses (so clean one!) The line to the bathroom was ridiculous and it took about 30 minutes to actually get there to use it. When kicked out at the end, I asked a bouncer if I could use the bathroom since I did just pay them a shit ton of money for their poor drinks and he said "I should've gone wee when I had the bloody chance." ugh. Despite all of my negativity towards Tiger Tiger, I had a lot of fun! This place is totally out of my comfort zone, but my American accent attracted a lot of interesting Brits (not just chavs!) 2 stars are given to the people I met, and none are given to the club itself.

DbbChl3mv3MSGLkm_lvPWQ.text: I hated my night out at Tiger Tiger. It was student night, but we still had to pay £7 to get in. The very weak coke and rum I bought was something like £4. And we still had to pay £2 for coat check. On top of that, I lost £10 somewhere between paying at the door and giving coat check my coat.Money issues aside, the club still sucked. My friend booked the VIP room for her birthday party, but the bouncer wouldn't let me in because I didn't get a wristband, not even after she personally asked him to. While she went off in search of more wristbands, me and the three girls I went with wandered over to the bar. The place was packed with obnoxious foreigners, unattractive men, and pretentious 16 year old girls teetering on five-inch heels. The music wasn't bad (I like top 40s pop, okay?), but that's about the only positive thing I can say about the night. Then again, I might just be bitter about the whole thing because three boys showed up and dragged my friends away, leaving me to go home alone. Regardless, I wouldn't go back again.

dzFffWNIfqVvGRVcYNYWAg.text: Apart from the food being a little timely to come out I really had a good experience. The staff were polite and warm. The food and value was great!Guys you must visit the urinal (You'll  be amazed at todays technology)!

rosOFNfeXzM9X3rJvNdLyQ.text: So I came here for a hen do and it was ok. There was nothing special about it but its a club. I had always heard bad things about this place which slightly put me off but as I was attending a hen night I didn't have a choice so came here. I was not impressed at all. I'm not a fan of clubbing anymore but on the odd nights out I have ended up going clubbing just to have a dance and carry on enjoying myself with the group I was with. I definitely would not come back here as I found it horrible and it reminded me of student nights out where the floors are sticky, takes ages to get served, all the guys who are here are just trying to pull for the night and it is not my thing. Due to the bad experience, I left early.

vZgFzrbTaRZP5lqFa5ilkQ.text: I've been here twice and both nightd were quite disappointing. The first time There weren't any people, it was literally just our group upstairs.Yesterday I visited tiger tiger for their Spanish night and if you are in to that I strongly advise you to go to Walkabout's Brazilian nights on Mondays because the atmosphere at Tiger Tiger was very very dull. They asked two pounds for entrance and then another two pounds per item you want to store kn the cloakroom which is quite ok, but as my friends and I were carrying quite a lot, we decided to just put it against the wall where we were dancing and nothing got stolen, so you could say the crowd was ok. One of the things I do find positive about this place is the fact that people of all ages (above 18 ofcourse) are dancing here.Lastly I would like to comment that the venue lookes really good and it is located very centrally but in my opinion it is not word another visit!

5y9b-XnlNTmfS_-QRXVWqA.text: Broadcasting the game on a Sunday afternoon and No beer on tap... Expecting people to pay more than £5 for a bottle of bud? Seriously?!

xnnNW8bVDjbOHKv13YfKrA.text: I walked into Tiger Tiger shaking my head. I *knew* it was the kind of place I didn't want to go, but it was 2:30 in the morning and friends were eager to carry on, and to be fair, Tiger Tiger was still going strong.So we drank, we danced, I got silly and I got oogled and then decided to call it a night. It's not my scene, but mostly because of the outrageous music and other patrions that just made me feel uncomfortable. If it were quieter, calmer, and a bit more chill, I'd probably enjoy it as a cocktail bar. Maybe that's the way it is earlier in the night?

1A94BggUgTMwrKPGaMe0yw.text: Awful, manager and bouncers were immature. Don't bother

2_6reNbxDtyrcwIwr8mQaQ.text: DO NOT GO HEREbouncers were incredibly rude even after we had prepaid for a 21st bday party. We were on a guestlist and everyone stil treated us like crap. Drinks are overprice, people are old and really lame, guys are creepy. Go to another bar around this area, they are all the same. At least you will skip the rude, dumb, and hurtful bouncers and people who work at Tiger Tiger.

dMRxWbWnCO9S9hBxEbLKXQ.text: Went here on Sunday and didn't enjoy it! Too expensive, too tacky and just not good. Would try and find somewhere else if you can!

grwv3b6v0xvkVT8pyRaWsw.text: Decor is decent, 3 floors with a bar places to dance on each. Drinks are average priced. Went here on a Thursday night with some Americans, had an OK time.. I'm glad they had variety in the music! Downstairs placed more house/EDM, upstairs was more top 40 and the ground floor I was too busy ordering drinks to remember =PAll in all an average nightclub experience, nothing that really blew my socks off, but no major complaints either

htRau06L3VPTgqgHLGVHRQ.text: Haters! I loveeeee this club! The happy.hours.are.tops! The drinks during the evening are inexpensive for London. Great.crowd of attractive men, dance music galore, and a less than snooty attitude. The only reason they get 4 stars the stairs. Heels + stairs don't get along LOLHit this place up for a good time without many boundaries!

QjNUt14efGaLIzZpc6bJVA.text: 5 or so years ago when I was last here this was a serious cougar bar.  At the advice of a co-worker we decided to go to tiger tiger ( which he to this day refers to as "totty, totty").  The happy hour deals were great, but man was the crowd of varying quality.

uuDmD_wc19XQmDHBprHh_Q.text: One of the funnest nights of my life started here. Some dude who spilled a drink on me at another bar took my friends and I here to apologize. He paid our cover, and bought us drinks all night long, so I have no idea what it actually cost. But boy, was it fun. I spent most of my time in the disco lounge downstairs. There was a good mix of Brits and tourists there.

ZRL1h0apJIInVuW21E1ANA.text: So this place wasn't the best dance club I went to while I was in London but it definitely wasn't the worst!  Sure the top 40 hall on the main floor was a bit cliche, however I enjoyed meeting all the people that were there.  Maybe it's being a yank or the fact that I was having travelers goggles but I still enjoyed myself quite a bit.  I by far enjoyed the bottom floor dance hall.  Who doesn't like retro disco on retro disco lighted floor and disco ball??

40Ckvk5SVaWfWW6JOwvnRQ.text: Tiger Tiger is so much fun! I had a great time here, I didn't even drink, just danced all night to some seriously good tunes!

qPO9WACuGyBtfiGrC1vhNQ.text: My first club experience in the UK, so I have no other comparison. I was told it was a "meat market" and that it was. Lots of people there for Old Year's Night so I am not sure how the usual crowd is. I was visiting from the US ,so I may not ever know any other. After some creepy encounter, I didn't have fun and the food wasn't too bad. The outside bouncer were nasty rude and retarded though. No customer service and I will not be back because of that.

rDYEm7Vbep9iTK7Em8OTJQ.text: Friend celebrated the big 2-1 at Tiger-Tiger, we paid a £5 fee for food and a booth on the second floor which was a bit small but we only used the booth to rest our feet after tottering on heels all night, which BY THE WAY-TONS OF STAIRS, my feet haven't forgiven me. Agreed with previous yelpers that it's a bit chavvy, a bit top40/generic but the bottom floor, the 1980s and 1990s floor is pretty good. I only say that because the ground floor and top floor was jam packed and you couldn't move without being groped (Intentionally, might i add! urgh!), the bottom floor was much more casual, less packed and far more people up for a laugh than uhm, for no better words, getting it on. Drinks were reasonable for London, didn't try cocktails, the bar on the second floor is invisible, i mean that there are no lights in the bar, but the bar men soldier on, they still do their cocktail tricks, even if nobody can make out what they're doing...

TDt67j4xwY1Xn-AGge5wnw.text: DO NOT GO HERE!!! First off the place is WAY too loud! The workers are not helpful or nice. When we went to close out our tab it took 20 minutes for them to tell us that they gave our credit card to someone else by accident. We spoke with the manager who said he would comp our bill. When we got back to the hotel we canceled our credit card. Well when we got back to the US we looked at our credit card statement and the scum bag they gave our card to used it at several places after AND they did NOT comp the bill!!! This place sucks!!

tQHEMIl_zHnbLi54YBLmUA.text: Please shoot me so I don't have to go in here. Ever. Actually, maybe just wound me so that I have an excuse not to go in.It's expensive and huge. So many floors, it's a "Chav Labyrinth" of disco balls, lights and terrible R'n B. Tacky in a terrifying way, it's not Disneyland and yes that is a man with a uni-brow who had just boobed grazed you is now trying to separate you from your friends. If you have fun here, I judge you and not in a good way.

zmeITeAo96dVpvMyQgrdqA.text: It's like marmite. You're going to love it or hate it. It has its uses, but mostly it's a place to avoid.We nestled right in with the cliche - we came here for a stag-do. We knew we needed somewhere that would turn a blind eye to possible silly behaviour and some irresponsible drinking. And they did just that, but they'll charge you the pleasure. It's not cheap here!It's a big old place on different levels - all with a slightly different take on 'Chav'.But really, if you want a silly old night then you could do worse. Just don't take anyone here to impress them.

skIsN7u1BN9N7jpebBUUUQ.text: This definitely wasn't one of my favorite places in London but it was fun and they did play a lot of Top 40 music which we had a lot of fun with when we were there. As we always went out as a large group of girls, we tended to hear top 40 and flock towards this type of music and it generally meant we would have a great time.I don't think we paid cover when we went here, or it wasn't as expensive as everyone here mentions as I can't remember spending too much here. I do remember several of the guys that were in our group mentioning this being the "cougar" club meaning that there were always a lot of skankily dressed older women that would frequently hit on them. Us girls always got a kick out of that along with the large numbers of men in suits that were here.We generally had a great time everywhere we went and this place was just the same.

hj0Wh4HT7QeWd8rKK1CAjA.text: UCB.  M.  We Bbv CNBC hiH l. Pool   G b. I'll call g c   M b mb. I un.  Unvvn. O. Z Hcm&?2?cl.   B be h.   Tv h C bad hm c fy  cd  Evfeefbescs oz. CeCe. E n Can   We    $::   W w2z was w bug You

1CB3iO-p9JxVrIxrd2IaFw.text: What the heck is this place?Is it a bar, is it a night cub, is it a restaurant?If the answer is restaurant - they've got a long way to go. Shoddy service, unappetizing (and pricey) food... we tried a burger and a steak.No way would I return - I didn't enjoy my visit here even a little bit. And I cannot recommend staying away from Tiger Tiger enough. No, thank you. Pass.

ZR57l4Q0jhuy0YkcLeOyzg.text: Come here for the happy hour--2 for 1 drinks (6p-8p)!  My boyfriend and I came from out of town so we used our passports to get in.  They have a scanner to verify.  Bartenders are kind, but perhaps because the crowds were light when we came.  Place felt slightly dirty to us.

iSQmx-wZsiJgQYJMc311ng.text: Friends and I watched the Bra-Bel match there . It was happy hour , so great if you want to drink a lot . But the queue is just impossible ! Every table was booked and the bar was full . We had free shots , warm and good people around . Although Brazil lost , we had one of the greatest after-game party downstairs , dancing , singing and drinking ( safely ) . The security does a good job and it was really a good time we had there . Nice experience !

KZKlRDyokhOhK7mTK3nUZg.text: So I actually enjoyed the vibe at Tiger Tiger at first and thought it maybe a good joint. The first and second night I came here I had  multiple random staff members bump into me very aggressively with their elbow and interrupt my good time. The place is confusing and the alcohol is super overpriced. Don't have too good of a time or else a security guard will ruin it for you by literally not saying anything and jabbing you with their elbow killing your good vibe(multiple times). You couldn't really say this place was a club. It's a wannabe club that doesn't function well at alI . I saw so many young women leave after just 45 mins in there because it couldn't facilitate young, classy, intelligent, and beautiful women. The place is disgusting .Several male staff members could give less of a shit about the customers. The bouncers at the front are awesome though. But once you get inside the staff literally treats you like a dollar sign and doesn't care if you have a good time (trust me they treat everyone like an animal and keep trying to get you to spend more money and get more intoxicated. Don't get me started on the music. It's the same  playlist every night( for a fact ). The music and strobes will make your ears ring and vision blurry. The place makes me sick .Don't let these pieces of shit rip you off. Last but not least I felt as though I should mention one more thing. I was calmly sitting on the black couch in the Luxe section by mysellf hitting my juul ( small e-cig) when a security guard came over to me and told me to stop( which I did). He then signaled over two more security guards who escorted through a back exit to the front of the venue and said they would talk to the manager about me using my e cig and if the manager would let me back inside. I was ultimately tricked. Outside I was walked over to the manager who asked me to hand over my ID which I cooperated and he then gave it to the front bouncer so he could re scan the ID and "ban" me. I was never given a warning or even said a word to before they decided to escort/ban me outside . I was banned for using my e-cigarette once on the couch inside. I was very cooperative and did not cause any issues in the "club". That should sum up the fact that this is one of the most backwards clubs in London. Do not come here if you want a good time. You will be strongly disappointed.Cheers to the manager, you dehumanized the wrong customer, buddy.

UkhhLfNiJOt7DWTGl9ECBA.text: Had lunch here when visiting London and the service was great. They have great deals on some of their foods when you come in between 12-5pm. It was a bit empty when I walked in around 1:30 but I think they get more crowded when it's late since it's suppose to be a night club too. Would recommend to others

photos.caption: Photo of Tiger Tiger - London, United Kingdom. Cheese burger and fries
Photo of Tiger Tiger - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Curry with rice and naan bread
Photo of Tiger Tiger - London, United Kingdom. Mozzarella Sticks Appetizer

wtjKCRaf5yejZfHvVI6gWg.text: If you're interested in the bar/club scene, don't expect to show up and have a party awaiting you. In a large group, this place can be a blast. The DJ is very wishy-washy, mostly trash music with a few outdated hits here and there. Nice venue, and would be a lovely space to rent for a private party. "Tiger Tuesday " is a fad they push. The bring a group concept applies here- it would not be enjoyable with only one or two mates, but a larger group can make it into a great night. I've heard it's much more popular on the weekends.

5JeJO8bEu0qwEXpQT00eAA.text: Cover: £15Posh, high-end vibe. The most I've had to pay for a cover charge in London. I've been here a couple times, it is in a nice location of London, and everyone dresses nice. They have multiple dance floors, we are always switching. This place has tons of bars, which is good for getting drinks quickly. I love dancing so I don't mind this place, while my friends are okay about this place. Lots of older gentlemen though, and my girlfriends describes them as aggressive. I am giving this place three stars because they charged my mate for two double shots when we ordered singles.

RKUC4s0wuPGN0L7Xw26j-A.text: Love this place! Perfect for a night out with drinks flowing and lots of dancing.Yay to multiple dance floors. So hop around and move through genres.Drinks are reasonably priced. Staff is not too friendly, but who cares while partying?!

amrvs5GZ7iuU2opt-QR0bQ.text: **This review is for lunch, we didn't realize this was a dance club, we were just hungry XD**We were drawn into Tiger Tiger by 3 things:1) Hunger walking around Piccadilly Circus2) The £4 lunch promo3) TIGERS! (our family likes tigers)It was an extra £2 to have a drink with the lunch items. (Coke in a glass bottle? Fine, £2 it is.) I ordered a fishfinger sandwich, which came with a little salad on the side.Not much else to say! The food was pretty good and I expected food in this area to be a bit pricier.Very chic feel inside and the servers were pretty nice. No real complaints. Will have to try back about its dance club status. :P

photos.caption: Photo of Tiger Tiger - London, United Kingdom. Spiced tuna melt
Photo of Tiger Tiger - London, United Kingdom. Fish finger salad
Photo of Tiger Tiger - London, United Kingdom. Was this real rosemary? I was too cowardly to taste the plant on my table. XD

bk4m3TYedw10NR57W4kHqw.text: We are from USA and came here and we got pulled out of line because my friends 200$ nikes did not meet the dress code when other people had converse and after talking to security they tried to cut us a deal for a table for 400$ pounds which is over kill I will not be coming back in my life time just don't waste your time people

XkiobuRDI_0arUBJNJaqKA.text: I dont know why everyone hates this joint, but Ive had a blast every single time. Maybe because Im a tourist and I don't know any better.  Yet I think the place never disappoints.

h4iq0K4n9rGvobufDX95hw.text: I've come here twice for 2 friends' birthdays because they aren't from London so went for the easy option of going to Leicester square. We got on the guest list both times because of it being their birthdays, but I've heard there is an entry fee if not, which I wouldn't pay. The club itself is alright, there is a downstairs dining space and then an upstairs area with booths that can be reserved along with the guest list. The prices are ridiculous. I mean, I guess you'd expect them to be in central London but I took £20 with me foolishly thinking that would do it, and a double vodka coke was £11. Safe to say I had to pay on my card a few times!I've never had food here, but I wouldn't. When you go to the smoking area of Tiger Tiger, you have to walk through the eating area. On the occasions I have done, I've seen people sat trying to have a quiet dinner and have drunken people (like me) stumbling through. My tip would be, if you're not familiar with London and looking for somewhere to go on a big night out, try somewhere else. It's not all it's cracked up to be.

mqeoKs-ewMXuxXLbxQv47g.text: Cannot describe how much I hate this place. Was there yesterday, every beer every alcohol was a vastly overpriced, and the worst possible quality available, so they can hike up their margin, using the minimum outlay. So I decided to order a Baileys (you know the stuff your granny drinks). Anyway here's the thing, it was actually DILUTED. Having drunk enough of the stuff in my life (with my granny of course, honest,), I would estimate the ratio of water that had been introduced to this was roughly in the 30% to 50%. The staff were trying their best, and not too bad, but the general air of the place is a bit sinister, and not good. Avoid at all costs.

dDjQYpaSUtKCQMvzzq735A.text: Ugh... meat market. Never again.Drinks are £5+ for either a spirit or a beer. The bar staff were not very friendly and it took ages to get served. Our friend had booked a cocktail making class for her birthday. When they showed up in the afternoon, no one had any knowledge of the class and had no one there to conduct the class. Apparently they said that she could get free guest list, but we were charged when we got in. They messed up my friend's birthday and the place was awful. Avoid like the plague.

_JzlnRsyP7IeolP9btBitA.text: Decent burger and steak fries. The best thing about this place is its cheaper than TGIFridays and there wasn't a wait. Happy hour is 5-8 so my wine was half off. However, I wouldn't recommend it (Garnacha), try the Merlot instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Tiger Tiger - London, United Kingdom. Britton burger, steak fries, and Garnacha red wine

mf3dk9aSU_wZfEqLgWb1bg.text: I must be getting old.We weren't in the dance section but the pounding music was loud enough on the 2nd floor that I had had to yell during my conversations.Then they played Journey's "Don't Stop Believing" coupled with "Gangnam Style."If I'm paying 12 for a drink, please don't hire a DJ working off the YouTube Top 20.I can just as easily stay home... which is where I went soon after.

G0OFgnU3ikRpXbhm86CEaw.text: Awful. Not worth the entry fee and line (for guys, girls basically are ushered in). The music is too loud with an awful sound system, and the people are generally creepy inside, I hate to say..would not recommend ever!!

ztUrEmbWNqvCz512rwKIfA.text: Went here for my work Christmas party ! WasAwful I payed 40 pound for the package of a 3 course meal , Glass of champagne and free entry to the club ! We got to the club for happy hour and I was told that spirits wasn't part of happy hour And pretty much was only wine and champagne etc which I hate ! The bar staff wereExtremely rude ! It was packed in there and for a club they were playing old Christmas music ?? The music was honestly so crap!!! The food was awful extremely small portions and disgusting I felt sick after eating the starter ! I pre ordered my meal and ordered duck as my starter which I received and it was basically a really nasty pate paste on a slice of white bread !!! The glassOf champagne wasn't even filled up it was about a quarter of the glass! Absolute rip off ! The prices !? Don't even get me started ! Extremely expensive they charged me over 12 pound for a drink ! And the shots wereMore expensive then the drinks themselves I left early that night really didn't enjoy myself ! Won't be going back ! Avoid

M6OKJO3M1SgT2aUhTYv88g.text: Been there a couple of times, both times ok. Beers cost £3 til 8pm when the happy hour finishes. Then it jumps to 5, just when it starts to get crowded.Food is pretty decent, but there's not a big selection.Music is loud, mostly commercial electronic.The real deal starts after the tables are removed and people get to the dance floor.If you are around Covent Garden with no place to go, or looking to dance a little bit before going home, then you'll be satisfied.

147CE_JYOspKzmuFGutzFA.text: In the JungleOnly £7 for a jug of cocktails during happy hour (5-7) and £4 for a bottle of house wine!!! You can't beat those prices anywhere in the west end can you? Sure it is full of people trying to pull, but it's not so bad for a group of you. Perhaps for a leaving do or office party.

2kvSNkUHsxONwWgTfDFlTA.text: Went to Tiger Tiger Saturday evening. If you go early then no problem in waiting, food I thought was quite pricey you can eat for less else where where staff have more time for you. Here in Tiger Tiger staff where more interested in quickly taking your order so that you can vacant the table! It can be quite crowded. So I think there are far more better clubs and bars around London!
